reviewText: In our household, we call this the "miracle video". We've been using this video for as long as I can remember - maybe 20 years or so. We have it in VHS and I'm going to get it in DVD. I bought two VHS copies because I was so worried that something would happen to just one and didn't ever want to be without it! It seems so simple and obvious - and yet the gentle, systematic program that builds so sensibly and gently over time is just the best ever. Having had quite a few episodes of back problems - from acute to moderate - over the years, I can speak from experience with this video. It has been a lifesaver many times over. It is excellent and wise.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've had this DVD for a number of years now. My back pain was the result of a bulging disc, herniated disc, pinched nerve....whatever you choose to call it, it is all the same. I've been to the doctor (pain meds), chiropractor (3 times a week for life please), surgeon (i can fix that with this little knife), physio (see me 3 times a week for life...again). Don't forget the good old steroid injection that only helps 50% of the people and will almost never fix what ails you.When I began these exercises, I could hardly move. I mean I could not do the vast majority of the moves from week one without some great deal of pain and discomfort. Go slow and do these properly. I am pain free and feel great. Sometimes that pesky disc wants to hit a nerve and just one week of these puts it back in place.The taping of this looks like something from the 70's that is going to break out into a porn film. Big hair on the ladies and mustaches for the men. Pretty funny. And the voice over sounds something like Hal from 2001. I keep on expecting him to ask me to reach into my pocket and give him money like some cult.I highly recommend this DVD. Looks like they quit making it and can only be bought used. I wouldn't sell mine for $1,000, it is that good. (I should look into buying the rights to this one).I would also highly recommend supplementing this with Pete Egoscue's "Pain Free" book.
summary: Best Help For Your Back Pain Ever
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have a L5-S1 herniated disc. This is the program recommended to me by my orthopedist. It's worked for me. Since using I've only had minor flare ups every 3-4 years. Check with your doctor before using.However, after using for twenty four years I have developed a numbness in one leg which was diagnosed as an L4-L5 impingement. Physical therapy did not help but I discovered that if I discontinued daily use of these exercises the numbness went away. Unfortunately my lower back pain returns. So I now do the exercises about once every three days.
summary: Been using this program for 20 years

reviewText: Found this program on video tape at the library about 25 years ago. Exercises help every time I had problems with my lower back. I wanted a copy on DVD so I bought this. No surgery for me!!
summary: Thru exercise I do say goodbye to back pain

reviewText: Back pain is mostly due to poor or little muscle use on a daily basis. Weak abs make your back work harder, poor posture puts strain. This course was done with over 1,000 people in the YMCA in the 1980s. Over 80% were pain free within 6 weeks. Only 2 % got worse & 5% felt no difference.This comes with a nice booklet with many b&w; photos so once you are used to it, you don't have to go through the dvd to get what you are looking for.This is done on a stage with Dr. Alexander Melleby, M.S. teaching with 2 women in leotards & 2 men in shorts & tube socks demonstrating.This was redone in 2005 for dvd with many chapters for the intro, who Dr. Melleby is, the reserach, the Kraus, M.D. study, what causes back pain, the YMCA study, self-evaluation, the 6 Kraus-Webber tests & 3 chapters for each of the 2 weeks of the 6 week program.You can see video clips at their site backpaindvd com
summary: Great straight-foward tests & exercises to erase back pain
